title: Rhian Brewster explains Jurgen Klopp instructions over Liverpool first-team hopes
text:

Rhian Brewster says Jurgen Klopp has insisted his chance to impress in the first-team will come if he remains patient, with the 19-year-old still waiting to make his Premier League bow.

Brewster, who won the FIFA U-17 World Cup with England in 2017, joined Liverpool's academy from Chelsea in 2014 and made the bench for the senior team in last season's Champions League semi-final second leg against Barcelona and final against Tottenham .

He made his debut during the Reds' 2-0 win over MK Dons in the Carabao Cup in September, but has not yet managed to nail down a place in the first-team, with the likes of Mo Salah, Sadio Mane and Bobby Firmino all ahead of him in the pecking order.

(Image: Andrew Powell)

Speaking to Scouted Football , however, Brewster insisted he remained positive about his long-term future at the club, and said manager Jurgen Klopp's instructions about what he should be doing are very clear.

"Be patient and you'll play," said Brewster. "Wait for your time and hopefully it'll come.

"My relationship with him (Jurgen Klopp) is very, very good. He's easy to approach and easy to talk to. I think you need a manager like that.

"You can't think it's easy and you're just going to get there with your talent, because you need to work hard as well. I've seen a lot of people with talent but not everyone makes it because of the attitude and the drive."

(Image: Getty Images)

Brewster also fondly recalls being a part of the squad that won Liverpool's sixth European Cup in Madrid in June, and says he hopes he can build on his appearance against MK Dons.

"No doubt making my debut away at MK Dons was amazing, I hope it's the first of many," Brewster added. "The support of the fans was amazing, but being in Madrid was different."
description: The 19-year-old striker made his senior debut for the Reds in the Carabao Cup in September but has yet to feature in the Premier League
